scenario_title: Single-Event System Sabotage via Destruction of Critical OS Resources

why.details: A privileged insider, motivated by resentment or the potential for personal gain, attempted to disrupt critical system operations by targeting essential OS resources such as configuration files, system backups, or scheduled automation scripts.

how.description: Accessed the system with elevated privileges during off-hours and navigated to directories containing core operational components.
how.procedure: Privileged user leverages legitimate admin account or gains elevated access to enter system during an off-hours window and browse to critical OS/system directories.
observable_evidence: Login or session initiation during unusual time-window for admin role
Access to directories not typical for user behaviour
Use of admin credentials outside normal change-control window
how.impact: Initial foothold into system resources enables direct sabotage potential.

how.description: Identified and listed essential operating-system resources: configuration files, automation scripts, backups, or scheduled tasks.
how.procedure: Insider with elevated privileges performs resource-discovery of critical OS components, enumerates backup files, config scripts, scheduled tasks to plan sabotage.
observable_evidence: Directory listing/logs of key system folders (e.g., /etc, C:\Windows\System32, backup directories)
Accessing backup or config file metadata
Scheduled tasks enumeration by user account
how.impact: Mapping of system-critical components enables targeted sabotage rather than random destruction, increasing impact.

how.description: Executed deletion or modification commands to damage key system components, impairing the organizationâ€™s operational capabilities.
technique_name: Indicator Removal on Host: File Deletion
how.procedure: Insider uses admin privileges to delete or overwrite configuration files, backups, or disable scheduled automation scripts, thereby triggering system instability or downtime.
observable_evidence: High-volume file deletion or overwriting in critical system directories
Unexpected removal of backup files or scheduled tasks
System services stopping unexpectedly or errors related to missing config files
how.impact: Disruption of critical operations, potential downtime, loss of system integrity, increased cost of recovery and reputational damage.
